intro: Campelia scandens, commonly known as the silverleaf spongeplant, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has silvery-gray leaves that are covered in fine, fuzzy hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for coastal gardens. Campelia scandens is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
